entry.title: How to use Product migration object for Retail
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

We noticed that the materials being uploaded with the app Migration Cockpit, Migration Object "Product", aren't being sent as Retail to the system, but rather as normal materials. Our question then is:

  • How do we use the Migration Object "Product" to upload Retail data to the system?

If it helps, we're currently running an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023, FPS 02. Thanks!

Best regards,
Data migration experts


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: DDIC Structure for Migration Cockpit Objects
entry.content:
Hello,

we are trying to export data from our sap system to another sap system using the CSV files generated by the S/4 HANA Migration Cockpit. Thes file format is based on specific table structures as seen in image below (in this example for the customer object):

The issue is that we cannot find any corresponding DDIC structures such as "S_CUST_GEN". Do these table structures exist within the SAP System? Or is there a piece of code where these structures are dynamically created from where one could copy them to a DDIC structure?

Thank you, Victor

entry.title: Supplier direct transfer approach - BUT000 no entry
entry.content:
Hello dear SAP Community,

currently, I am trying to migrate suppliers from an SAP ERP system to a HANA 2022 SP4 system using the direct transfer approach in the Migration Cockpit. Unfortunately, I am facing two issues:

  1. Business partners are not being migrated, only suppliers (no entry in BUT000).
    1. The structure: with the BP ROLES is filled with 2 entries.
  2. The internal number assignment is not working. I receive the message:
    1. Business partner ##1 is not present --- R1-201.

By using the Staging approach with XML the function module is filled nearly the same and everything is working fine.

Thank you for your advice and best regards,

Lukas

entry.title: How to add other depreciation areas to migrated assets and delete data for migrated assets
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support, 

If I want to add value data to other depreciation areas for assets migrated using the "Migration Cockpit" app, is it possible to do so?
(Please tell me if there is a way other than using the "Post Transfer Values ‚Äã‚Äã- For Legacy Asset" app.) 
If possible, please tell me how to add data. 

 

Also, is it possible to delete data for many assets that have been migrated at once? (Please answer using a method other than using the Reset Transaction Data job template from the app Schedule Accounting Data Corrections.)
If possible, please tell me how to delete data.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: üöõ Migration vs. ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Upgrade: Understanding the SAP Essentials (With Real‚ÄëWorld Clarity!)
entry.content:
Ever heard someone say "We're upgrading to S/4HANA" when they really meant ‚Äúmigrating‚Äù to HANA? You‚Äôre not alone‚Äîthese terms are often misunderstood, but knowing the difference is critical üí°. 

Whether you're a consultant, a technical architect, or part of a functional team, or Business users understanding the difference is crucial for planning, execution, and business alignment. Knowing the difference between migration and upgradation can help you communicate better, plan smarter, and execute projects more efficiently.

 

üèóÔ∏è Migration = Moving House

You're shifting your entire SAP landscape‚Äîplatform, database, and deployment environment.
Common Scenarios:

  • On‚ÄëPrem Oracle ‚Üí SAP‚ÄØHANA

  • On‚ÄëPrem ‚Üí Cloud

  • Legacy ERP ‚Üí S/4HANA (Greenfield)

Tools: SAP Migration Cockpit, DMO, LSMW, Data Services
Focus: Data quality, performance, scalability

üõ†Ô∏è Upgrade = Renovation

Same house, but with brand‚Äënew features and updates.
Typical Use‚ÄëCases:

  • ECC 6.0 EHP5 ‚Üí EHP8

  • NetWeaver, GUI ‚Üí Fiori UX

  • ECC ‚Üí S/4HANA via Brownfield

Tools: SUM, Maintenance Planner, SPAM/SAINT
Focus: Functionality, user experience, compliance

üîç Quick Comparison

Factor Migration Upgrade
GoalNew platformNew version
Change TypeTech + functionalFunctional only
Data HandlingETL / cleansed loadRetain existing data
Risk LevelHigherLower
When to Choose?DB switch, greenfieldNew features, UX, support
 

üéØ Which One Do You Need?

  • Migration = Changing where or how your SAP runs

  • Upgrade = Improving what‚Äôs already there

üëâ Why It Matters

  • Align teams: set clear technical vs. business objectives

  • Optimize planning: scope, budget, risk & tool choice

  • Improve communication: speak the same language across IT & business

üì£ From the SAP Community

Have you tackled a migration or upgrade?

  • What was your biggest challenge‚Äîdata cleanup, downtime, custom code?

  • Any tools or tips you swear by?

Drop your insights below‚Äîlet‚Äôs build a resource together! üëá

üì≤ Let's Connect

Follow me for more SAP & S/4HANA insights, and reach out if you want to dive deeper!
LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/mirza-hasan-051369231

entry.title: Migration for Asset Under Construction in S/4 HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

Our fiscal period runs from April to March. Currently, we are uploading the opening data for April.

For Assets Under Construction (AUC), I have uploaded  using transaction type 900.

While all other asset balances are correctly dated March 31, 2025, the AUC amount is being recorded with April 1, 2025. I also migrated the GL opening balance with the date 31.3.2025. When I checked the opening balance in the trial balance with the date 31.3.2025, the AUC amount did not appear, but when I generated it with 1.4.2025, it showed up. As a result, the GL opening balance doesn‚Äôt match. What should I do about this? Has anyone else faced this case? How did you handle it? 

Could you please advise on the correct approach?

Best Regards,

Hnin

entry.title: Customer direct transfer approach with contact person
entry.content:
Hello dear SAP community,

I'm currently trying to migrate customers from an SAP ERP system to a HANA 2022 SP4 system. I'm using the direct transfer in the migration cockpit. Unfortunately, I'm having problems when the customer is assigned a contact person.

I'm getting the error message "Business partner ##1 does not exist." Error message R1-201

Where do I need to change the number assignment in Customizing so that the transfer works? Should it be possible to transfer business partners with contact persons using internal number assignment in one go?

Thank you for your tips and kind regards,

Lukas

entry.title: BOM component loaded wrongly in Routing
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

I am using LTMC to create ROUTING and in Component Assignment tab the information for ITEM ID , BOM Component and Item Number is mismatch when compare to BOM, like ITEM ID and Item Number are not matched with the BOM Component which I want to load. Due to which the BOM Component tagged to that routing is wrong. 

Now we want to remediate the data means wants to update the correct BOM Component . Need your advise on how to achieve that.

 

Thanks,

RJ

entry.title: Migration cockpit: Value mapping tables
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to use Data Migration cockpit to load customers from legacy system post transformation from ETL tool using staging tables. In DMC I can see in the Mapping tasks there is specific item named  "Mapping of Customer". This table shows the Customer Key that I used vs the BP ID used by the system.

Where does this information gets saved? How do I access this, apart from this mapping task where in I want to download the legacy vs SAP BP number.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Migrating Open Service Purchase Order
entry.content:
Hi, 

 

currently the migration of Service Purchase Orders (Item Category D) is not supported by the S/4Hana Data Migration Cockpit. Is it possible to extend the Open PO Data Object via the App Model Your Migration Objects - Migration Object Modeler?

The latest article that I found was from 2020 https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/migrating-service-purchase-orders-with-s-4hana-migration-cockpit/ba-p/13429420 - was there an update since thats?

 

Thanks

entry.title: Encrypted CSV, XML files by IRM seem not to be read by Migration Cockpit.
entry.content:
Dear experts,

My team has been exploring S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition's 'Migrate Your Data - Migration Cockpit' app with uploading data which is extracted from my company's ECC system. I am getting problems while migrating master data table to S4HC Public Edition

 

The restrictions of my workplace's environment:

When we modify and save the excel file at this company, it is automatically encrypted through IRM(Information Rights Management). But what we modify in the NotePad is not encrypted. This applies to both the csv format and the xml format as well.

 

As I tried, encrypted files by IRM seem not to be read by Migration Cockpit. The error occurs during upload even before execute Data Validate.

We need to confirm whether IRM really causes interruptions between users and SAP system.

 

Case 1

Uploaded encrypted files with CSV format. The system does not recognize the file is encoded by UTF8.

 

Case 2

Uploaded encrypted files with XML format. And then, failed.

 

 

Regards,

Wonpyo

SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit

entry.title: The necessity of Migration Cockpit DMC_NOTE_ANALYZER
entry.content:
Hi There,

Based out of previous Data Migration experiences, there is a step of "Note Analyzer" to implement SAP Notes for DMC corrections.

And this was mainly to avoid unnecessary errors during Migration Cockpit data upload, which is already being resolved & published by SAP.

We would need your support to understand:

Do we really need this ?
How important this is to implement the DMC correction Notes?
how to proceed further ?

Thanks

entry.title: Data Migration Cockpit - QM Inspection Plan PLKN (Group Node)
entry.content:
Hi team,

 

We are building the mapping to migrate QM Inspection Plan through Migration Cockpit - but we don't have the field PLNKN (Group Node) in the target structures in the LTMOM.

I searched for ways to map this - since it's an standard key field in PLPO table but with no luck.

Can anyone provide some support on how to proceed? Is there a way to easily add the PLNKN or it's already there hidden in some source structure?

Thank you for all the support.
